name: Angel's Trumpet Draught
effect: To play this card, return 2 of your {P} Lessons from play to your hand. Do 7 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice.

name: Angelina Johnson
effect: Before each of your turns, if there is a Match in play, you get 1 more Action that turn.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Witch o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: '... what an excellent Chaser that girl is, and rather attractive, too -- ' -- Lee Jordan, commentator

name: Aparecium
effect: Show your hand to your opponent. Put all Lesson cards there into play.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'She tapped the diary three times and said, Aparecium!'

name: Arthur Weasley
effect: Once per turn, you may use an Action to choose 1 of your Items in play and do damage to your opponent equal to its printed Power cost.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'He was a thin man, going bald, but the little hair he had was as red as any of his children's.'

name: Backfire!
effect: Do 5 damage to your opponent.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... Ron's wand was still malfunctioning, surpassing itself on Friday morning by shooting out of Ron's hand in Charms and hitting tiny old Professor Flitwick squarely between the eyes, ...'

name: Badgered Boy
effect: Search your deck. You may take a Creature card from your deck, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Professor McGonagall was shouting at someone who, by the sound of it, had turned his friend into a badger.'

name: Beater's Bat
effect: You may use an Action and discard a card from your hand to do 2 damage to your opponent.

name: Beetle Buttons
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Creatures in play and discard it.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... Ron's mood was not improved by Hermione showing them the handful of perfect coat buttons she had produced in Transfiguration.'

name: Blagging
effect: Do 8 damage to your opponent. Then, if your opponent has any cards in play (other than his or her starting Character), he or she chooses 1 of them and discards it.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Will you stop messing around! he yelled. That's exactly the sort of thing that'll lose us the match!' -- Oliver Wood

name: Blocked Barrier
effect: Effect: Your opponent can't use Actions to play Location cards. To Solve: Your opponent chooses 2 Location cards in his or her hand and discards them. Opponent's Reward: Once during this turn, when your opponent uses an Action to play a Location card, he or she gets 2 more Actions this turn.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Why can't we get through? Harry hissed to Ron.'

name: Blocked!
effect: Draw 4 cards. Then your opponent may choose a Lesson card from his or her hand and discard it. If he or she does, you choose 3 cards in your hand and discard them.

name: Body Blow
effect: Do 8 damage to your opponent. Then your opponent may choose a Lesson card from his or her hand and discard it. If he or she does, you take 8 damage.

name: Broken Wand
effect: You may use an Action to reveal the top card of your deck. If it's a Lesson card, put it into play. If it isn't a Lesson card, discard it. If you play this card, and you already have a Wand in play, discard the old one. Provides C

name: Bundimun Ooze
effect: Your opponent chooses 1 of his or her Creatures or Items in play and discards it. Then he or she takes damage equal to that card's printed Power cost.

name: Catching Apples
effect: Do 3 damage to your opponent. Then, if your opponent has any cards in play (other than his or her starting Character), he or she chooses 1 of them and returns it to his or her hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'They couldn't use real Quidditch balls, which would have been hard to explain if they had escaped and flown away over the village; instead they threw apples for each other to catch.'

name: Caught by Snape
effect: Effect: Your opponent can't use Actions to play any cards except Lesson cards. To Solve: Your opponent uses Actions to play Lesson cards 3 times. (Those Actions don't need to be one right after the other.) Opponent's Reward: Your opponent may put any number of Lesson cards from his or her hand into play.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Most unfortunately, you are not in my house and the decision to expel you does not rest with me.' -- Professor Severus Snape

name: Caught!
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's cards in play (other than his or her starting Character) and discard it. Your opponent may prevent this by choosing 4 cards in his or her hand and discarding them.

name: Checked!
effect: Do 4 damage to your opponent. Then your opponent may choose a Lesson card in his or her hand and discard it. If he or she does, you take 4 damage.

name: Chudley Cannons Robes
effect: You may use an Action to put up to 2 cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck (in any order).

name: Cleansweep Five
effect: When you play this card, look at the top 2 cards of your deck (1 if there is only 1) and put both of them on the bottom or back on the top of your deck in any order. If you play this card, and you already have a Broom in play, discard the old one. Provides Q

name: Colin Creevey
effect: Once per turn, you may use an Action to draw 3 cards and then make your opponent draw 3 cards.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'I never knew all the odd stuff I could do was magic till I got the letter from Hogwarts. My dad's a milkman, he couldn't believe it either.'

name: Copper Cauldron
effect: To play this card, return 1 of your {P} Lessons from play to your hand. Provides PP

name: Counter Curse
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Creatures in play and put it on the bottom of his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Snape stepped forward, waved his wand and the snake vanished in a small puff of black smoke.'

name: Crazed Capybara
effect: When you play this card, draw a card.

name: De-Gnoming the Garden
effect: Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play. Effect: At the end of each of your opponent's turns, if he or she has any cards in his or her hand, he or she chooses 1 of them and discards it. To Solve: Your opponent discards 5 cards in this way. Opponent's Reward: Your opponent may draw a card.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'It doesn't hurt them -- you've just got to make them really dizzy so they can't find their way back to the gnomeholes.' -- Ron Weasley

name: Death-Cap Draught
effect: To play this card, return 1 of your {P} Lessons from play to your hand. Do 6 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice.

name: Deboning
effect: During your opponent's next turn, he or she can't use Actions to play cards.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Ah, said Lockhart. Yes. Well, that can sometimes happen. But the point is, the bones are no longer broken.'

name: Dizziness Draught
effect: Do 4 damage to your opponent. During your opponent's next turn, he or she can't use Actions to play Quidditch cards.

name: Dobby's Disappearance
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's cards in play (other than his or her starting Character) and return it to his or her hand. You get 1 more Action this turn.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Dobby must go! breathed the elf, terrified; there was a loud crack, and Harry's fist was suddenly clenched on thin air.'

name: Dobby's Help
effect: Your opponent draws 10 cards.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'You know what, Harry? If he doesn't stop trying to save your life he's going to kill you.' -- Ron Weasley

name: Double-Beater Defence
effect: To play this card, discard 2 other cards from your hand. Do 5 damage to your opponent. Then, if your opponent has any cards in his or her hand, he or she chooses 2 of them and discards them (1 if he or she has only 1).
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Fred and George Weasley are the Gryffindor Beaters.' -- Harry Potter

name: Draco the Seeker
effect: If your opponent has any cards in his or her hand, you may use an Action to make him or her choose 1 of them and discard it.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Slytherin o Unique
• Flavour text: '... we're going to make them rue the day they let that little bit of slime, Malfoy, buy his way onto their team.' -- Oliver Wood

name: Dragon Poison
effect: To play this card, return 2 of your {P} Lessons from play to your hand. Do 10 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice.

name: Dragon-Dung Compost
effect: Before each of your turns, count the number of Plants you have in play. Do that much damage to your opponent.

name: Dumbledore's Office
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). All Item cards (yours and your opponent's) need 3 less Power to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches.)
attributes: • Flavour text: 'It was a large and beautiful circular room, full of funny little noises.'

name: Earmuffs
effect: Once during each of your turns, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Creatures in play. Prevent up to 3 damage from that Creature on your opponent's next turn.

name: Endless Sandwiches
effect: Play this card only if you have fewer than 7 other cards in your hand. Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'A large plate of sandwiches, two silver goblets and a jug of iced pumpkin juice appeared with a pop.'

name: Engorgement Charm
effect: Remove all damage counters from all of your Creatures in play.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'An Engorgement Charm, I suppose? said Hermione, halfway between disapproval and amusement. Well, you've done a good job on them.'

name: Entrancing Enchantments
effect: Search your deck. You may take a Character card from your deck, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... Professor Flitwick knows more about Entrancing Enchantments than any wizard I've ever met, the sly old dog!' -- Professor Gilderoy Lockhart

name: Errol
effect: When you play this card, reveal the top card of your deck. If it's a Lesson card, put it into play. If it isn't, put it back on top of your deck.

name: Escaping the Dursleys
effect: Effect: Your opponent can't use Actions to play non-Lesson cards. To Solve: Your opponent discards his or her hand. Opponent's Reward: Your opponent searches his or her deck for any card, puts it into his or her hand and then shuffles his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Petunia! roared Uncle Vernon. He's getting away!'

name: Evanesce
effect: Choose a Creature or Lesson in play and discard it.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Professor McGonagall's classes were always hard work, but today was especially difficult.'

name: Family Ghoul
effect: To play this card, return 1 of your Creatures in play to your hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... I'm right underneath the ghoul in the attic, he's always banging on the pipes and groaning ...' -- Ron Weasley

name: Fat Friar
effect: Once per game, you may draw 2 cards, then do 2 damage to your opponent and then put up to 2 non-Healing cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Ghost o Hufflepuff o Unique
• Flavour text: 'Hope to see you in Hufflepuff! said the Friar.'

name: Fatiguing Fusion
effect: To play this card, return 1 of your {P} Lessons from play to your hand. Do 9 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice.

name: Fawkes
effect: Each turn, you may prevent 4 damage done to you. If Fawkes is discarded from play, put it into your hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Fawkes, said Harry, isn't an ordinary bird.'

name: Fighting the Basilisk
effect: Play this card only if you have at least 7 Lessons in play. Effect: Before each of your turns, your opponent takes 5 damage. To Solve: Your opponent chooses 4 of his or her cards in play (other than his or her starting Character) and discards them. Opponent's Reward: You take 5 damage.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'The Basilisk's head was falling, its body coiling around, hitting pillars as it twisted to face him.'

name: Flacking
effect: Do 2 damage to your opponent. Then, if your opponent has any cards in his or her hand, he or she chooses 1 of them and discards it.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'And there's the Keeper, too. He guards the goalposts.' -- Harry Potter

name: Floo Powder
effect: Search your deck. You may take a Location card from your deck, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Floo powder's a lot quicker, dear, but goodness me, if you've never used it before -- ' -- Mrs Weasley

name: Flying Car
effect: You may use an Action to choose an Adventure or a Location in play and discard it. (If you discard an Adventure, you don't get the reward.)

name: Flying Laps
effect: Count the number of Lessons you have in play. Do that much damage to your opponent. Then draw that many cards.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'He soared right around the stadium at full speed, racing Fred and George.'

name: Flying to Hogwarts
effect: Effect: Before each of your turns, your opponent takes 2 damage. To Solve: Your opponent skips a total of 5 Actions. (They don't need to be one right after the other.) Opponent's Reward: Your opponent may look at your hand, choose 1 of those cards and discard it.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'This, thought Harry, was surely the only way to travel: ... '

name: Forgotten Password
effect: During your opponent's next turn, he or she can't use Actions to play Lesson cards.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'I've been out here for hours. I couldn't remember the new password to get in to bed.' -- Neville Longbottom

name: Freezing Charm
effect: Do 4 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'He just wants to give us some hands-on experience, said Hermione, immobilising two pixies at once with a clever Freezing Charm and stuffing them back into their cage.'

name: Garden Gnome
effect: At the end of each of your opponent's turns, if there are any cards in his or her hand, he or she chooses 1 of them and discards it.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'They love it here ... Dad's too soft with them, he thinks they're funny ...'

name: Ginny Weasley
effect: Before each of your turns, count the number of other Characters you have in play. You may draw that many cards.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Witch o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'You don't know how weird it is for her to be this shy, she never shuts up normally -- ' -- Ron Weasley

name: Greenhouse Three
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). Once during each player's turn, when he or she uses an Action to play a Plant card, he or she gets 1 more Action that turn.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'They had only ever worked in Greenhouse One before -- Greenhouse Three housed far more interesting and dangerous plants.'

name: Gryffindor Common Room
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). Before each player's turn, he or she counts the number of Gryffindor cards he or she has in play and may draw that many cards.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'They ... found themselves in the Gryffindor common room, a cosy, round room full of squashy armchairs.'

name: Gryffindor Lion
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Their daring, nerve and chivalry Set Gryffindors apart; ...' -- The Sorting Hat

name: Guide to Household Pests
effect: You may use an Action and discard this card from play to choose a Creature in play and do 4 damage to it. Provides CMC

name: Hair-Raising Potion
effect: Do 1 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Ron was just saying he wished he had asked Hermione how many rat tails you were supposed to add to a Hair-Raising Potion, ...'

name: Harry, Second Year
effect: At the start of the game, if Harry, Second Year is your starting Character, secretly write down the name of a Creature, Item or Spell card. If your opponent plays that card, you may reveal what you wrote down. If you do, at the end of that turn, you may shuffle up to 20 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'Can't hurt to have a poke around, said Harry, dropping his bag and getting to his hands and knees so that he could crawl along, searching for clues.'

name: Hawkshead Formation
effect: Do 6 damage to your opponent.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Three Chasers on each team throw the Quaffle to each other and try and get it through the goalposts at the end of the pitch -- ...' -- Harry Potter

name: Hermione's Note
effect: Discard the Adventure your opponent has played. You get the reward.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Ron, he breathed, this is it. This is the answer.' -- Harry Potter

name: Hermione, Potion Maker
effect: You may use an Action to put up to 2 Lesson cards of different types from your hand into play.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Witch o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'I'm sure I've done everything right, said Hermione, nervously re-reading the splotched page of Moste Potente Potions.''

name: History of Magic Homework
effect: Search your deck. You may take a Lesson card from your deck and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Hermione, let me read your composition, said Ron desperately, ...'

name: Hover Charm
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's cards in play (other than his or her starting Character) and return it to his or her hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Aunt Petunia's masterpiece of a pudding, the mountain of cream and sugared violets, was floating up near the ceiling.'

name: Howler
effect: Do 2 damage to your opponent. Then, if your opponent has any cards in his or her hand, look at them. Choose 1 of those cards and put it on top of his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'You'd better open it, Ron, said Neville, in a timid whisper. It'll be worse if you don't. My Gran sent me one once, and I ignored it and -- he gulped, it was horrible.'

name: Hufflepuff Badger
attributes: • Flavour text: 'You might belong in Hufflepuff, Where they are just and loyal, ...' -- The Sorting Hat

name: Impersonating Goyle
effect: Choose a Character in play (other than a starting Character) and discard it. Then search your deck. You may take a Character card from your deck, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Ron, who had been gazing at Harry, said, You don't know how bizarre it is to see Goyle thinking.'

name: In the Spider's Lair
effect: Effect: Before each of your turns, you may show your opponent any number of Creature cards from your hand. Your opponent takes that much damage. To Solve: Your opponent takes 10 damage. Opponent's Reward: If you have any cards in your hand, you choose 1 of them and discard it.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... I cannot deny them fresh meat, when it wanders so willingly into our midst.' -- Aragog

name: Invisibility Section
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's cards in play (other than his or her starting Character) and discard it. Then he or she chooses 1 of your cards in play (other than your starting Character) and discards it.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... he paused to listen, hidden in the Invisibility section.'

name: Invisible Ink
effect: Choose up to 2 Lessons in play and discard them.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'It might be invisible ink! she whispered.'

name: Justin Finch-Fletchley
effect: You may use an Action to draw 2 cards and then put 2 cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck (in any order).
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Hufflepuff o Unique
• Flavour text: 'My name was down for Eton, you know, I can't tell you how glad I am I came here instead.'

name: Keeping Dobby Quiet
effect: Effect: Your opponent discards the card drawn at the start of each of his or her turns. To Solve: Your opponent takes 8 damage. Opponent's Reward: You take 2 damage.
attributes: • Flavour text: Er -- I don't want to be rude or anything, but -- this isn't a great time for me to have a house-elf in my bedroom.' -- Harry Potter

name: Leaping Toadstools
effect: Once per turn, you may let Leaping Toadstools take 1 damage that you were going to take.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... Ernie Macmillan asked Harry quite politely to pass a bucket of leaping toadstools in Herbology one day, ...'

name: Locked In
effect: Effect: Your opponent gets 1 fewer Action on each of his or her turns (even the turn this Adventure is solved). (If this would mean your opponent has fewer than 1 Action, he or she still gets 1 Action.) To Solve: Your opponent chooses 4 cards in his or her hand and discards them. Opponent's Reward: Your opponent may draw 2 cards.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'What was the good of magicking himself out of his room if Hogwarts would expel him for doing it?'

name: Lockhart's Hair-Care Potions
effect: Whenever you play a Character card, you use up 1 Action to play it instead of 2.

name: Lockhart's Lecture
effect: Effect: Whenever you use an Action to play a Spell, your opponent says 'Brilliant!' If your opponent forgets, he or she takes 3 damage at the end of that turn. To Solve: Your opponent lets you have 4 more Actions on your next turn. Opponent's Reward: You take 3 damage.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Harry had no idea what he was talking about.'

name: Magical Mess Remover
effect: Choose any number of your cards in play (other than your starting Character) and discard them.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Harry had seen him scrubbing the message on the wall with Mrs Skower's All-Purpose Magical Mess Remover, but to no effect; ...'

name: Mandrake
effect: You may use an Action and discard Mandrake from play to put a non-Healing Character card from your discard pile into your hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Instead of roots, a small, muddy and extremely ugly baby popped out of the earth.'

name: Manticore
attributes: • Flavour text: 'It is my job to arm you against the foulest creatures known to wizardkind!' -- Professor Gilderoy Lockhart

name: Memory Charm
effect: Your opponent chooses 1 card in his or her hand and discards the rest.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'If there's one thing I pride myself on, it's my Memory Charms.' -- Professor Gilderoy Lockhart

name: Moaning Myrtle's Bathroom
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). Before each player's turn, if he or she has at least 2 Characters in play (including his or her starting Character), he or she gets 1 more Action that turn.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'It was the gloomiest, most depressing bathroom Harry had ever set foot in.'

name: Molly Weasley
effect: You may use an Action to search your deck. You may take a Character card for a Weasley character from your deck, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Mrs Weasley fussed over the state of his socks and tried to force him to eat fourth helpings at every meal.'

name: Nimbus Two Thousand and One
effect: Whenever one of your Quidditch Spells does damage to your opponent, it does 3 more damage. If you play this card, and you already have a Broom in play, discard the old one. Provides QQ

name: No Hands
effect: Play this card only if there is a Match in play. Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Lesson card, you win the current Match (you get the prize). Otherwise, you take 3 damage.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Harry took his remaining hand off his broom and made a wild snatch; ...'

name: Norwegian Ridgeback
effect: To play this card, return 2 of your {A} Lessons from play to your hand.

name: Overdue Homework
effect: Look at your opponent's hand. Count the number of Lesson cards there. Do that much damage to your opponent.

name: Pepperup Potion
effect: Put up to 4 non-Healing cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck (in any order).
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Her Pepperup Potion worked instantly, though it left the drinker smoking at the ears for several hours afterwards.'

name: Percy Weasley
effect: At the end of each of your opponent's turns, if he or she played a non-Lesson card that turn, he or she takes 1 damage.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'I, said Percy, drawing himself up, am a Prefect. Nothing's about to attack me.'

name: Petrified
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Creatures or Characters in play (other than his or her starting Character) and put it on the bottom of his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'She has been Petrified, said Dumbledore ... But how, I cannot say ...'

name: Phoenix Tears
effect: To play this card, return 4 of your {P} Lessons from play to your hand. Shuffle up to 16 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Fascinating creatures, phoenixes. They can carry immensely heavy loads, their tears have healing powers and they make highly faithful pets.' -- Albus Dumbledore

name: Potions Homework
effect: Your opponent takes damage until he or she discards a Lesson card from his or her deck.

name: Potions Project
effect: Your opponent takes damage until he or she discards a total of 2 Lesson cards from his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Potions lessons took place in one of the large dungeons.'

name: Potions Test
effect: Your opponent takes damage until he or she discards a total of 3 Lesson cards from his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Snape prowled through the fumes, making waspish remarks about the Gryffindors' work while the Slytherins sniggered appreciatively.'

name: Prickly Porcupine
effect: When you play this card, draw a card.

name: Professor Pomona Sprout
effect: Each of your Plants has 2 more Health. Provides CMC
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Witch o Hufflepuff o Unique
• Flavour text: '... there was usually a large amount of earth on her clothes, and her fingernails would have made Aunt Petunia faint.'

name: Pure-Blood
effect: When you play this card, play it face down and tell your opponent to guess 'Pure-Blood', 'Sherbet Lemon' or 'Wattlebird'. If he or she guesses 'Pure-Blood', nothing happens. Otherwise, do 8 damage to your opponent.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'What's the new password again? he said to Harry.'

name: Rabbit Slippers
effect: Choose up to 2 Creatures in play and discard them.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Harry looked down at the pair of white rabbits he was supposed to be turning into slippers.'

name: Rainy-Day Match
effect: To Win: Do 9 damage to your opponent. (That damage doesn't have to be done all at once.) Prize: Winner shuffles up to 6 non-Healing cards from his or her discard pile into his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Fred and George were now flying so close to him on either side that Harry could see nothing at all except their flailing arms ...'

name: Ransacked!
effect: Your opponent chooses 2 cards in his or her hand and discards them (1 if he or she has only 1).
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Someone's been looking for something, said Ron. Is there anything missing?'

name: Ravenclaw Eagle
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Or yet in wise old Ravenclaw, If you've a ready mind, ...' -- The Sorting Hat

name: Reparo
effect: Put a non-Healing card from your discard pile into your hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Mr Weasley took Harry's glasses, gave them a tap of his wand and returned them, good as new.'

name: Restoration Potion
effect: Do 4 damage to your opponent. During your opponent's next turn, he or she can't use Actions to play Transfiguration cards.

name: Revealer
effect: You may use an Action to look at your opponent's hand.

name: Rogue Bludger
effect: Before each of your turns, your opponent takes 3 damage.

name: Ron, Youngest Brother
effect: If you have no cards in your hand, you may use an Action to draw 5 cards.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'Everyone expects me to do as well as the others, but if I do, it's no big deal, because they did it first.'

name: Rose Growth
effect: Do 2 damage to your opponent or to a Creature of your choice. Then draw a card.

name: Second-Hand Robe Shop
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). Whenever a Spell card (yours or your opponent's) does damage to a player, it does 1 less damage to that player.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'I expect we'll be able to pick up a lot of Ginny's things second-hand.' -- Mrs Weasley

name: Self-Shuffling Cards
effect: You may use an Action to have both players shuffle their decks.

name: Serpensortia
effect: Search your deck. You may take up to 2 Creature cards from your deck, show them to your opponent and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Malfoy raised his wand quickly and bellowed, Serpensortia!'

name: Sherbet Lemon
effect: When you play this card, play it face down and tell your opponent to guess 'Pure-Blood', 'Sherbet Lemon' or 'Wattlebird'. If he or she guesses 'Sherbet Lemon', nothing happens. Otherwise, do 8 damage to your opponent.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'This was evidently a password, because the gargoyle sprang suddenly to life, ...'

name: Shooting Star
effect: You may use an Action and discard a card from your hand to draw 2 cards. If you play this card, and you already have a Broom in play, discard the old one. Provides Q

name: Slinking Ferret
effect: When you play this card, draw a card.

name: Slow-Acting Venom
effect: Before each of your turns, your opponent takes 1 damage.

name: Slytherin Common Room
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). Before each player's turn, he or she counts the number of Slytherin cards he or she has in play and does that much damage to his or her opponent
attributes: • Flavour text: 'The Slytherin common room was a long, low underground room with rough stone walls and ceiling, from which round, greenish lamps were hanging on chains.'

name: Slytherin Serpent
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Those cunning folk use any means To achieve their ends.' -- The Sorting Hat

name: Slytherin Steals
effect: Do 2 damage to your opponent. Then, if your opponent has any cards in play (other than his or her starting Character), he or she chooses 1 of them and discards it.

name: Spiders' Exodus
effect: Return all Creatures in play (yours and your opponent's) to their owners' hands.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Have you ever seen spiders act like that? said Hermione wonderingly.'

name: Swelling Solution
effect: Do 8 damage to your opponent. He or she can prevent this by choosing 3 cards in his or her hand and discarding them.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Harry tried not to laugh as he watched Malfoy hurry forward, his head drooping with the weight of a nose like a small melon.'

name: The Burrow
effect: When you play this card, discard any other Location from play (yours or your opponent's). Before each player's turn, if that player has fewer than 4 cards in his or her hand, that player draws cards until he or she has 4.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... Harry, grinning widely, said, This is the best house I've ever been in.'

name: The Weasley Twins
effect: Before each of your turns, if you have an Adventure in play, your opponent takes 2 damage.
attributes: • Keywords: Character o Wizard o Gryffindor o Unique
• Flavour text: 'You had to hand it to them, thought Harry, as George took an ordinary hairpin from his pocket and started to pick the lock.'

name: Through the Floo
effect: Effect: Before each of your opponent's turns, he or she draws 3 cards and then chooses 3 cards in his or her hand and discards them. To Solve: Your opponent chooses 1 of his or her Locations in play or 4 of his or her Lessons in play and discards them. Opponent's Reward: You take 3 damage.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'It definitely wasn't his favourite way to travel.'

name: Training Programme
effect: Draw 2 cards. Then you may put up to 2 {Q} Lesson cards from your hand into play.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Oliver, Harry croaked, it's the crack of dawn.''

name: Twirl
effect: Do 5 damage to your opponent. Then, if he or she has any cards in play other than Lessons (or his or her starting Character), he or she chooses 1 of those cards and returns it to his or her hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Training for the ballet, Potter? yelled Malfoy, as Harry was forced to do a stupid kind of twirl in mid-air to dodge the Bludger.'

name: Umbrella Flowers
effect: Once per turn, you may let Umbrella Flowers take 1 damage that you were going to take.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Harry caught a whiff of damp earth and fertiliser, mingling with the heavy perfume of some giant, umbrella-sized flowers dangling from the ceiling.'

name: Vanishing Cabinet
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Items in play and put it on the bottom of his or her deck.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'That vanishing cabinet was extremely valuable!' -- Argus Filch

name: Venomous Tentacula
effect: You may use an Action and discard Venomous Tentacula from play to put a {P} Lesson from your discard pile into play.
attributes: • Flavour text: '... be careful of the Venomous Tentacula, it's teething.' -- Professor Sprout

name: Venomous Tentacular Juice
effect: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. He or she draws twice that many cards.

name: Wattlebird
effect: When you play this card, play it face down and tell your opponent to guess 'Pure-Blood', 'Sherbet Lemon' or 'Wattlebird'. If he or she guesses 'Wattlebird', nothing happens. Otherwise, do 8 damage to your opponent.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Skip the lecture, said Ron impatiently, and tell us the new password.'

name: Whomping Willow
effect: To play this card, return 3 of your {A} Lessons from play to your hand. Before each of your turns, if your opponent has any Items in play, choose 1 of them and discard it.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.' -- Ron Weasley

name: Windy-Day Match
effect: To Win: Use Actions to play Spell cards 2 times while this card is in play. Prize: Loser takes 6 damage.

name: Wizard Chess
effect: You may use an Action and discard 1 of your Lessons from play to do 2 damage to your opponent.

name: Zig-Zag
effect: Put a non-Healing Quidditch card from your discard pile into your hand.
attributes: • Flavour text: 'On Madam Hooch's whistle, Harry kicked hard into the air and heard the tell-tale whoosh of the Bludger behind him.'
